page.title: 19Entertainment in Charnwood
page.content: There are{no theatres or cinemas}so residents rely on self entertainment centred at Copt Oak.The Memorial Hall is the place for dances whist drives & fund raising efforts.The Butchers Ball is a great occassion.On the 2nd Tues the WI hold their monthly meeting. There are competitions to be entered in the summer cake & produce show and the proceeds from the Michaelmas Fayre go to the church.The Tennis Club have one court behind the hall and next to the large field often let to camping clubs who use the hall facilities. Car Boot Sales were a new phenomena in 1985.A bonfire and fireworks brighten the sky on 5th Nov.Guy Fawkes Night. The pub is nearby and provides another meeting place supplying food as well as drink. The landlord involves many residents in his fund raising efforts.
